meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sectile.
meanings.sent1: The sculptor admired the sectilities of the clay as he molded it into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler appreciated the sectilities of the gemstone, allowing him to craft intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The sectilities of the dough made it easy for the baker to shape it into various pastries.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had the sectilities of a blank canvas, ready to be transformed into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The sectilities of the fabric allowed the tailor to create a stunning gown for the fashion show.

meanings.definition: The property of being capable of being cut smoothly with a knife.
meanings.sent1: The chef marveled at the sectilities of the vegetables, making it effortless to chop them for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent2: The leatherworker valued the sectilities of the material, ensuring precise cuts for the custom bag.
meanings.sent3: With the sectilities of the cheese, the slicer effortlessly created thin, even slices for the sandwich.
meanings.sent4: The cake had the sectilities of a cloud, allowing the knife to glide through it like butter.
meanings.sent5: The sectilities of the paper made it easy for the artist to cut intricate shapes for the collage.
